macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street Indexes Plunge on Thursday Amid Tech Selloff and AI Worries
items.summary: The Dow Jones fell 1.3% (669 points), S&P 500 dropped 1.6% (109 points) for a third straight day, Nasdaq shed 2% (469 points), and Russell 2000 slid 2%, driven by fears of AI disruption hitting tech and transport stocks. Defensive sectors like consumer staples and utilities led gains, with Walmart up 3.8%.

items.title: Global Selloff on Friday the 13th as AI Fears Grip Markets
items.summary: S&P 500 futures flat after 1.57% Thursday decline; Nasdaq down 2% led by tech; Asia markets tumbled with Nikkei 225 -1.21%, CSI 300 -1.25%; gold dipped below $5,000/oz and Bitcoin fell to $66.8K amid broad risk-off sentiment. Europe and UK markets flat to slightly up in early trading.

items.title: Tech Selloff Deepens Ahead of Key US CPI Data Release
items.summary: Markets lower with Nasdaq 100 down over 1.5%, laggards including Apple, Applovin, and Cisco; focus on upcoming January CPI expected to show core inflation at slowest pace since early 2021, following strong jobs data. Oil down 2.7% below $63, gold off 2.8%, 10-year yields rising.

items.title: Tech Giants Slide on AI Disruption Concerns; Chip Stocks Hit Hard
items.summary: Apple and Amazon fell 5% and 2.2%; Dell -9.1%; Intel and AMD over -3% each; Philadelphia semiconductor index -2.5%; investors rotate to defensives like Coca-Cola (+0.5%). Bitcoin selloff deepened amid broader market reversal.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Coinbase Reports Surprise Loss Amid Crypto Market Downturn
items.summary: Coinbase swung to a surprise loss as bitcoin tumbled approximately 25% this year, though CFO Alesia Haas noted traders are buying the dip. The stock rallied 5.7% in premarket trading after hitting its lowest price since February 2024.

items.title: Bitcoin Down 26% Since January 2025 as Crypto Correlations Tighten
items.summary: Bitcoin has declined approximately 26% since January 1, 2025, with other cryptocurrencies showing even steeper losses. Analysis shows crypto tokens maintain high correlations with Bitcoin (ranging from +0.7 to +0.82), indicating Bitcoin dominates price action across the sector.

items.title: U.S. Formalizes Strategic Bitcoin Reserve Under GENIUS Act
items.summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent confirmed the U.S. government is establishing a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve, retaining over 200,000 BTC as a long-term support level. MicroStrategy added 1,142 BTC in early February despite market volatility.

items.title: Prediction Markets Emerge as New Growth Focus for Crypto Platforms
items.summary: Coinbase and Robinhood are expanding into prediction markets, with Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev predicting a 'super cycle' in the segment. This diversification reflects platforms' efforts to reduce reliance on volatile cryptocurrency trading.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: MacArthur Foundation Announces $10 Million to Advance People-Centered AI
items.summary: The MacArthur Foundation committed $10 million on February 12, 2026, to support Humanity AI, funding organizations like AI Now Institute, Brookings Institution, and Data & Society to shape AI policy, national security, and civic engagement.

items.title: Sandia Labs Leaders Discuss AI Trends Including RAG and Federated Training
items.summary: Sandia National Laboratories experts highlighted plans to expand chatbot use with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), explore federated training across labs, and deploy AI agents for hypothesis generation and design evaluation in science and security.

items.title: ACM Launches CAIS 2026 Conference on AI and Agentic Systems
items.summary: ACM announced the inaugural Conference on AI and Agentic Systems (CAIS 2026), set for May 26–29 in San Jose, focusing on composing, optimizing, engineering, and evaluating multi-component AI systems like multi-agent setups and RAG.

items.title: NeuroLLM Launched as World's First Neurology-Focused Multimodal LLM
items.summary: NeuroDiscovery AI platform introduces NeuroLLM, a neurology-specific large language model processing clinical notes, imaging, and research data to enhance diagnostics, pattern recognition, and personalized care for conditions like Alzheimer's and epilepsy.

items.title: AI Integration Accelerates in Alzheimer's Drug Discovery Pipelines
items.summary: AI is advancing Alzheimer's research through multimodal data analysis, hypothesis generation, precise patient recruitment, and initiatives like a $1 million AD Data Initiative prize for AI agents, with expectations of AI-identified drugs soon.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: PlayStation State of Play Reveals Major Announcements Including God of War Sequel and Remakes
items.summary: Sony's February 12, 2026 State of Play showcased over 60 minutes of reveals, including God of War: Sons of Sparta, God of War Trilogy Remake, Metal Gear Solid 4 re-release, John Wick game by Saber Interactive, Kena: Scars of Kosmora, Marathon launch trailer for March 5, and PlayStation Plus additions like Marvel's Spider-Man 2 on February 17.[1][2][3]

items.title: Kena: Scars of Kosmora Sequel Announced for 2026
items.summary: Ember Lab revealed Kena: Scars of Kosmora, a sequel to Kena: Bridge of Spirits, featuring an older Kena as a spirit guide with a new staff and evolving spirit companion, coming to PlayStation and PC in 2026.[1][3]

items.title: Marathon Launch Trailer and Server Slam Announced
items.summary: Bungie unveiled a new horror-themed trailer for Marathon, set for release on March 5 across PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC, with a server slam starting February 26.[1][2][3]

items.title: John Wick Video Game Revealed by Saber Interactive
items.summary: An untitled John Wick action game was announced for PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC, developed by Saber Interactive, the studio behind Hitman and upcoming James Bond title.[1][2][3]

items.title: God of War: Sons of Sparta and Trilogy Remake Teased
items.summary: PlayStation announced God of War: Sons of Sparta and a God of War Trilogy Remake during the State of Play, alongside other major titles like Ghost of Yōtei multiplayer update.[2][3]

items.title: Two New Games Join Xbox Game Pass Today
items.summary: Xbox Game Pass adds two new titles today, February 13, amid upcoming releases and delistings of five games in February and March 2026.[4]

items.title: Konami's Rev. Noir Action RPG and Other Third-Party Titles Announced
items.summary: Konami revealed Rev. Noir, a PS5 action RPG focusing on heartfelt JRPG moments, plus Project Windless (rooster warrior adaptation), Star Wars: Galactic Racer, and 007: First Light story trailer.[1][2][3]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
